title: Amazing Rice Planting Technique That Will Blow Your Mind! #shorts #agricultural #farmer #technique

subtasks: Approach the greenhouse.
Put on appropriate protective gear.
Retrieve tomato seedlings from storage area.
Fill planting trays or containers with soil.
Plant the tomato seedlings at the correct depth.
Water the newly planted seedlings.
Label or mark the planting trays for future reference.
Return any unused seedlings or materials to storage.
Drive the agricultural water truck to the field.
Connect the water hose to the truck's water outlet.
Walk the perimeter of the field, checking for any broken lines.
Adjust sprinklers or nozzles as needed.
Operate the water pump to ensure proper water pressure.
Monitor water distribution across the field.
Keep water flowing for the required duration.

tasks.task: Harvesting carrots from a raised bed.
subtasks: Move towards the raised bed containing carrots.
Bend knees and squat to reach the carrots near the soil.
Grasp carrots by their base and pull them out carefully.
Inspect the harvested carrots for any damage or pests.
Place the harvested carrots into a basket or bin.
Dispose of any debris or unwanted soil.
Gather lettuce seedlings from nursery pots.
Prepare the garden plot by loosening the soil.
Dig holes for the seedlings with a trowel.
Carefully place each seedling into its hole.
Cover the roots with soil and press lightly.
Water the transplanted seedlings to settle the soil.
Mix the fertilizer according to package instructions.
Pour the mixture into a portable sprayer.
Walk between tomato plants, distributing the fertilizer evenly.
Pay attention to not oversaturate the leaves.
Clean the sprayer after use.

tasks.task: Operating a hay baler in a field.
subtasks: Drive the hay baler into the harvested area.
Engage the sensors to detect hay to be baled.
Monitor the hay intake and header height.
Adjust the baler's belt tension if necessary.
Keep an eye on the balers filling up and retrieve bales when full.
Stack or transport the bales as needed.
Walk along the irrigation lines in the field.
Check for leaks, cracks, or obstructions in the pipes.
Make a note of any problematic areas.
Verify that sprinkler heads are functioning correctly.
Test the water flow and pressure at different points.
Adjust or replace any malfunctioning components.
